  4. Aug 2015-Dec 2015

    Software Release Manager • Opencast Project

  5. Oct 2011-Feb 2016

    Online Learning Environments Developer • CILT, UCT

    • Systems Developer and Systems Administrator involved in the deployment of the first Lecture recording project at the UCT, that was launched in February 2012.
    • Facilitated the integration of Vula (an open source LMS) and Opencast (an open source video capture and distribution system) by developing the Learning Tools Interoperability (LTI) tool that students use to view and download recordings within Vula. This UI has been customised by other universities to provide content to their students.
    • Enhanced the LTI tool to use the Opencast Rest APIs to enable lecturers to self manage their recordings, schedule them, as well as upload recordings.
    • Scaled up the cluster to its present state to support the growing needs of the project. Development of an IP camera dashboard for monitoring IP cameras used for the Lecture Recording Project.
    • Mentored and coached team members.
    • Technical Liaison between CILT and Information and Communication Technology Ser- vices (ICTS) on the Lecture Recording Project.

  6. Aug 2010-Oct 2011

    Back-end Developer / QA Engineer • Unboxed Consulting (PTY) Ltd

    • Quality Assurance Engineer on the SCRUM team that launched the new bespoke Channel5 UK website.
    • Ruby (on Rails) back-end developer for the Big Brother UK project, for Channel 5.
    • Ruby (on Rails) back-end developer involved in the code refactoring exercise for the Timesheets application, used by Unboxed, including the addition of extra functionalities and user experience enhancements.

  7. Jul 2007-Jul 2010

    Analyst Developer / MIS Officer • MIS, Mimosa Mining Company.

    • Ensured 24-hour availability of the platinum mine's Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.
    • Designed and developed intranet applications that were used mine-wide to serve over 2000 employees. The applications served up-to-date documents and daily production statistics.
    • Appointed as one of the mine-wide ISO 14001 and OHSAS 18001 internal auditors in 2010, in preparation for the external audit, we were successfully recertified that year.

Education

  1. Submitting Feb 2018

    MSc. in Computer Science (Part time)

    Dissertation: Accelerated Cooperative Co-Evolution on Multi-core Architectures

    Description:

    The Cooperative Co-Evolution model has been used in Evolutionary Computation to optimize the training of neural networks. This architecture has proven to be a useful extension to domains such as Neuro-Evolution (NE), which is the training of neural networks using concepts of natural evolution. However, there is a need for real-time systems which has prompted a further need to optimize these Cooperative Co-Evolution methods. Cooperative Co-Evolution methods consist of a number of phases, however the evaluation phase is still the most computationally expensive phase, for some complex tasks taking as long as weeks to complete. This study uses NE as a test case study and we design a parallel Cooperative Co-Evolution processing architecture and implement the optimized serial and parallel versions using the Golang (Go) programming language.

    Supervisors : Michelle Kuttel & Geoff Nitschke.

    University of Cape Town, South Africa

  2. 2007

    Linux Administration Certificate

    Computer Centre, University of Zimbabwe, Zimbabwe

  3. 2001-2005

    B.Sc. (Hons) in Computer Science

    National University of Science and Technology, Zimbabwe
